channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9168] TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB fails on hadoop 2.0 due to FileNotFoundException
item.description:
NamespaceUpgrade is called by TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB
TestMetaMigrationConvertToPB.tgz doesn't contain .archive directory.
NamespaceUpgrade#migrateTables() calls listStatus() on .archive directory (hardcoded)
Due to change of behavior in hadoop 2.0, FileNotFoundException gets thrown and makes the test fail.
item.summary: TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB fails on hadoop 2.0 due to FileNotFoundException

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Patch v1 tries to align the behavior w.r.t. non-existent file among hadoop 1 and hadoop 2

TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB passes on hadoop 2 with the patch
Wrong direction I'd say Ted Yu Fix the tgz?
Yeah, we've gotten this far w/o need of this change in behavior. Why do we need it now? Better to expose 2.0's behavior than suppress it.

HBASE-6796 'Backport HBASE-5547, Don't delete HFiles in backup mode' went into 0.94.3
Meaning, earlier 0.94 releases wouldn't have .archive directory.

Looking at http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#upgrade0.96 , there is no mentioning of minimum 0.94 release from which user should upgrade from.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12597004/9168-v1.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 20 warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop1-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6673//console

This message is automatically generated.
We should update any 0.94 release I'd say. Put up a stack trace so can see where this is broke (or point at a build on apache). Can you check exists before assuming .archive?

Here is example:

http://54.241.6.143/job/HBase-TRUNK-Hadoop-2/org.apache.hbase$hbase-server/438/testReport/junit/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.catalog/TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB/org_apache_hadoop_hbase_catalog_TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB/


java.io.FileNotFoundException: File hdfs://localhost:35352/user/ec2-user/hbase/.archive does not exist.

	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem.listStatus(DistributedFileSystem.java:405)

	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem.listStatus(FileSystem.java:1430)

	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem.listStatus(FileSystem.java:1470)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.FSUtils.getLocalTableDirs(FSUtils.java:1317)

...

We are passing in a dir that does not exist (.archive)? NameSpaceUpgrade shouldn't do that. Should test for existence before proceeding.

Getting the same
Tests in error:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.catalog.TestMetaMigrationConvertingToPB: File hdfs://localhost:40624/user/root/hbase/.archive does not exist.
in linux. But locally on Windows it runs. JFYI.

We need to check for the existence. But the UserTableDirFilter is trying to filter out these directories like .archive, .logs etc.
But here the base path itself goes in with .archive to the UserTableDirFilter and hence it does not filter it.
I think as Ted has pointed out there is a change in the behaviour in 2.0 that is throwing this exception. Just attaching a simple patch that checks for existence but not sure of the implications wrt Namespace changes.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12597038/HBASE-9168_1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

A similar approach is to catch FileNotFoundException in NamespaceUpgrade.
This way existence check can be omitted.
Nope. We know .archive may or may not be present so test for it rather than add a general catch of FNFEs
